name: Micropub to GitHub
description: An endpoint that accepts Micropub requests, formats them into Jekyll posts and pushes them to a configured GitHub repository.

MICROPUB_GITHUB_TOKEN.description: An access token for the GitHub API. Get one at: https://github.com/settings/tokens

MICROPUB_GITHUB_USER.description: The GitHub user to which the configured repositories belongs.

MICROPUB_SITE_GITHUB_REPO.description: The name of your GitHub repository.

MICROPUB_TOKEN_ENDPOINT.description: The token endpoint to verify the micropub token against. See: https://indieweb.org/token-endpoint

MICROPUB_TOKEN_ME.description: Your personal domain name that the micropub token should represent. Defaults to site URL.

MICROPUB_OPTION_DERIVE_LANGUAGES.description: A comma separated list of languages to autodetect. Eg: eng,swe
